alert.note: Alert for Caguas; Gurabo; Juncos; Las Piedras; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 10:09PM ADT until September 19 at 5:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Caguas County in Puerto Rico... Gurabo County in Puerto Rico... Juncos County in Puerto Rico... Las Piedras County in Puerto Rico... San Lorenzo County in Puerto Rico... * Until 400 AM AST Monday. * At 909 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated hurricane rainbands producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 16 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by hurricane rainbands. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of mainstem rivers including Rio Gurabo, Rio Grande de Loiza and Rio Caguitas as well as small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Rio Gurabo at Gurabo has crested at 28.52 inches, well above moderate flood. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Caguas; Gurabo; Juncos; Las Piedras; San Lorenzo
